citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Male French bulldog ("Buzz", microchip # 900085000738639) has injuries received in a fight with another dog. The dog's
right hind foot is swollen and feels hot to the touch. The medial aspect of this foot was damaged in the fight and a large
section of hair, skin and underlying tissues is missing. This affected area starts at the top of the inside toe, wraps around
the side of the foot and covers approximately one-third of the bottom of the foot. Therefore, part of the large paw pad has
been torn off and blood is coating the hair on the bottom of the foot. The remaining skin on the top of the inside toe is
hairless and appears moderately reddened and swollen. A smaller injury was also identified near the toenail of the
outside toe. This injured area is moderately reddened and swollen. A reddened, hairless lesion is running across the top
of the middle toes towards the inside toe.
Several large injuries are also located along the left side of the dog's spine. The injured areas of skin are hairless and
covered in a thick crusty material. A section of skin had been torn from the dog's back and is still attached to one of the
affected areas. The hair coat surrounding the wounds is stiff and contains a hard dark colored material.
Female French bulldog ("Lucky", microchip # 900085000739079) has injuries received in a fight with another dog. Two
large wounds are located on the outside of the dog's left front leg. The center of the wounds are dark red and fresh blood
is located on the hair surrounding these injuries. A dark, scab-like material is located around the edges of both wounds.
A small abrasion is located on the bottom of the outside toe on the left front foot and a small amount of fresh blood was
found on the surface of this abrasion. Numerous small puncture wounds were also identified along the outside of the right
hind leg and fresh blood is located around many of these wounds. Areas of skin on the inside and outside of the right
hind leg are hairless and slightly reddened with many small red lesions located throughout. The outside of the left hind
leg also has several areas of hairless, reddened skin with numerous small wounds located throughout. Fresh blood is
also present around the wounds on the skin. The inspector was unable to conduct a physical palpation of the hind legs as
the dog appeared to be painful and withdrew the legs each time the inspector attempted to touch them.
The licensee stated that the two dogs got into a fight with each other approximately 3 weeks ago. The licensee had
provided the dogs with an antibiotic but has not consulted with a veterinarian about the injuries the dogs have sustained
and has not provided a treatment plan that has been approved by a veterinarian. Injuries received in fights could cause
pain and discomfort as well as lead to further health issues which could be detrimental to the dog's health and well-being.
Each dealer must use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The above-
mentioned dogs must be evaluated by a veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment plan.
The licensee must ensure that each animal receives adequate veterinary care at all times.
To be corrected by: End of business 30-March-2023

The information for six dogs is missing from APHIS form 7005 (Record of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats on Hand). Failure
to document the information required on APHIS form 7005 may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to identify
animals and to trace their movements.
Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the required information
concerning each dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under
his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of. The licensee must add the
information for the six dogs to APHIS form 7005 and ensure that all required documents are complete and contain all the
necessary information at all times.
To be corrected by: 05-April-2023

At least three plastic food receptacles are excessively chewed and damaged by the dogs. The damage is located along
the top edges of the feeders and brown colored dirt or food waste is attached to the chewed areas. A total of four adult
dogs have access to these food receptacles. Damaged plastic surfaces cannot be properly cleaned and sanitized which
could increase the risk of disease hazards.
All surfaces must be maintained on a regular basis. Surfaces of housing facilities - including houses, dens, and other
furniture-type fixtures and objects within the facility - that cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized, must be replaced when
worn or soiled. The licensee must replace the damaged plastic feeders or alter them in a manner that allows for proper
cleaning and sanitization of the surfaces. The licensee must ensure that all surfaces are properly maintained at all times.
To be corrected by: 12-April-2023

One enclosure, containing one adult dog and 4 puppies, has a heat lamp hanging from the top of the enclosure. The heat
lamp has no protective guard, and it is hanging low enough that the adult dog could come into contact with the glass bulb.
Direct contact with light bulbs could cause burns, as well as additional injuries if the glass should break.
Primary enclosures must protect the dogs from injury. The licensee must add a protective guard to the heat lamp or alter
it in a manner that eliminates the ability of the adult dog to come into direct contact with the glass bulb. The licensee must
ensure that the enclosures are safe for the animals at all times.
To be corrected by: 05-April-2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Male French bulldog ("Buzz", microchip # 900085000738639) has injuries received in a fight with another dog.  The dog's 
right hind foot is swollen and feels hot to the touch.  The medial aspect of this foot was damaged in the fight and a large 
section of hair, skin and underlying tissues is missing.  This affected area starts at the top of the inside toe, wraps around 
the side of the foot and covers approximately one-third of the bottom of the foot.  Therefore, part of the large paw pad has 
been torn off and blood is coating the hair on the bottom of the foot.  The remaining skin on the top of the inside toe is 
hairless and appears moderately reddened and swollen.  A smaller injury was also identified near the toenail of the 
outside toe.  This injured area is moderately reddened and swollen.   A reddened, hairless lesion is running across the top 
of the middle toes towards the inside toe.   
 
Several large injuries are also located along the left side of the dog's spine.  The injured areas of skin are hairless and 
covered in a thick crusty material.  A section of skin had been torn from the dog's back and is still attached to one of the 
affected areas.  The hair coat surrounding the wounds is stiff and contains a hard dark colored material. 
 
Female French bulldog ("Lucky", microchip # 900085000739079) has injuries received in a fight with another dog.  Two 
large wounds are located on the outside of the dog's left front leg.  The center of the wounds are dark red and fresh blood

is located on the hair surrounding these injuries.  A dark, scab-like material is located around the edges of both wounds.  
A small abrasion is located on the bottom of the outside toe on the left front foot and a small amount of fresh blood was 
found on the surface of this abrasion.  Numerous small puncture wounds were also identified along the outside of the right 
hind leg and fresh blood is located around many of these wounds.  Areas of skin on the inside and outside of the right 
hind leg are hairless and slightly reddened with many small red lesions located throughout.  The outside of the left hind 
leg also has several areas of hairless, reddened skin with numerous small wounds located throughout.  Fresh blood is 
also present around the wounds on the skin.  The inspector was unable to conduct a physical palpation of the hind legs as 
the dog appeared to be painful and withdrew the legs each time the inspector attempted to touch them.   
 
The licensee stated that the two dogs got into a fight with each other approximately 3 weeks ago.  The licensee had 
provided the dogs with an antibiotic but has not consulted with a veterinarian about the injuries the dogs have sustained 
and has not provided a treatment plan that has been approved by a veterinarian.  Injuries received in fights could cause 
pain and discomfort as well as lead to further health issues which could be detrimental to the dog's health and well-being.  
 
Each dealer must use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries.  The above-
mentioned dogs must be evaluated by a veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment plan.  
The licensee must ensure that each animal receives adequate veterinary care at all times. 
 
To be corrected by:  End of business 30-March-2023 
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors.

The information for six dogs is missing from APHIS form 7005 (Record of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats on Hand).  Failure 
to document the information required on APHIS form 7005 may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to identify 
animals and to trace their movements. 
 
Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the required information 
concerning each dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under 
his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of.  The licensee must add the 
information for the six dogs to APHIS form 7005 and ensure that all required documents are complete and contain all the 
necessary information at all times. 
 
To be corrected by:  05-April-2023 
3.1(c)(2) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
At least three plastic food receptacles are excessively chewed and damaged by the dogs. The damage is located along 
the top edges of the feeders and brown colored dirt or food waste is attached to the chewed areas. A total of four adult 
dogs have access to these food receptacles. Damaged plastic surfaces cannot be properly cleaned and sanitized which 
could increase the risk of disease hazards. 
 
All surfaces must be maintained on a regular basis. Surfaces of housing facilities - including houses, dens, and other 
furniture-type fixtures and objects within the facility - that cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized, must be replaced when 
worn or soiled. The licensee must replace the damaged plastic feeders or alter them in a manner that allows for proper 
cleaning and sanitization of the surfaces. The licensee must ensure that all surfaces are properly maintained at all times.

To be corrected by:  12-April-2023 
3.6(a)(2)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
One enclosure, containing one adult dog and 4 puppies, has a heat lamp hanging from the top of the enclosure.  The heat 
lamp has no protective guard, and it is hanging low enough that the adult dog could come into contact with the glass bulb.  
Direct contact with light bulbs could cause burns, as well as additional injuries if the glass should break.  
 
Primary enclosures must protect the dogs from injury.  The licensee must add a protective guard to the heat lamp or alter 
it in a manner that eliminates the ability of the adult dog to come into direct contact with the glass bulb.  The licensee must 
ensure that the enclosures are safe for the animals at all times. 
 
To be corrected by:  05-April-2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
End Section
